proper noun.description: The capital of Wyoming, in the southeastern part of the state; population 56,915 (est. 2008).

noun.description: A member of an Algonquian people formerly living between the Missouri and Arkansas Rivers but now on reservations in Montana and Oklahoma.
The Algonquian language of the Cheyenne.

adjective.description: Relating to the Cheyenne or their language.

origin: Canadian French, from Dakota šahíyena, from šaia speak incoherently, from ša red + ya speak.
